evaluations.outcome: Will Apple release an AI assistant better than Siri in 2024?
preconditions: Apple significantly increases its investment and focus on AI research and development
Apple is able to attract top AI talent to join the company
Apple is able to make substantial progress in natural language processing, machine learning, and other core AI technologies
Apple is able to integrate these AI capabilities into a cohesive and user-friendly virtual assistant
causal_path: Apple recognizes the competitive threat posed by ChatGPT and other advanced AI assistants
Apple allocates substantial resources (funding, personnel, etc.) to an AI development initiative
Apple makes strategic hires of leading AI researchers and engineers
Apple's AI team makes breakthroughs in key AI capabilities like natural language understanding, knowledge representation, and task-completion
Apple integrates these AI advances into a new virtual assistant product
The new AI assistant demonstrates significant performance improvements over Siri
blocking_factors: Apple struggles to attract top AI talent away from leading tech companies and research labs
Apple's AI development efforts fail to yield substantial improvements over Siri's current capabilities
Apple is unable to integrate the various AI components into a cohesive and user-friendly virtual assistant
The new AI assistant does not gain traction with consumers or fails to meet expectations
historical_analogies: Microsoft's efforts to develop a Siri-like virtual assistant (Cortana) in the early 2010s
Google's development of the Google Assistant, which has gradually improved over time to become a more capable AI-powered virtual assistant
key_milestones: Apple announces a major AI initiative and investment
Apple makes high-profile hires of leading AI researchers and engineers
Apple demonstrates significant AI breakthroughs in research and development
Apple unveils a new virtual assistant product with enhanced AI capabilities
The new AI assistant is released to the public and gains traction with consumers
evaluations.reasoning: Based on the current conditions, it is reasonably feasible for Apple to release an AI assistant better than Siri within the next year, but the probability of this occurring is only moderate. Apple has the resources and technical capabilities to make substantial progress in AI, but it will require a significant, focused effort to catch up to the current state-of-the-art in virtual assistants like ChatGPT. The key preconditions are Apple's ability to attract top AI talent, make breakthroughs in core AI technologies, and successfully integrate these capabilities into a user-friendly virtual assistant product. There are several blocking factors, such as Apple's struggles to develop the necessary AI capabilities or to gain consumer adoption of the new assistant. Historical analogies suggest that while it is possible for a tech giant like Apple to rapidly advance its AI offerings, it often takes multiple iterations and years of sustained investment to catch up to market leaders. Overall, I estimate a 45% probability that Apple will release an AI assistant better than Siri within the next 12-18 months, with a medium level of confidence in this assessment.

prediction.initial_conditions_summary: As of 2024-01-01: Apple lagging in AI, pressure to compete with ChatGPT
outcomes_of_interest: Will Apple release an AI assistant better than Siri in 2024?
